newsitem.title: PAKISTAN: Karachi building collapse death toll rises to five.
newsitem.headline: Karachi building collapse death toll rises to five.

text.p: Rescuers said on Thursday they could see three crushed bodies in the debris of a collapsed building in this city in southern Pakistan, raising the casualty toll to five dead and nine injured.
"There could be more bodies in the rubble as a lot of debris still has to be cleared," said a senior government official after a night-long rescue operation in Karachi North.
"We have started using bulldozers after checks that there are no more people trapped alive inside," he said.
Rescue workers initially said up to 45 labourers could have been inside the Faiza Heights apartment building when it fell to the ground early on Wednesday afternoon.
Officials have blamed the collapse of the almost-completed four-storey block on poor building materials.

Karachi's deputy inspector general of police, Mohammad Iqbal, said the project supervisor had been arrested and police were searching for the builders and the architect. "It was not negligence, they knew what they were doing," he told Reuters.

Karachi commissioner, the city's top administrator, Mir Hussain Ali, told Reuters television a murder case had been registered against the builders and engineers involved and this would act as a deterrent to other contractors in Karachi.
"This incident took place because of defective construction and structural failure," he said. "Probably the builders were not using the proper ingredients for construction."
